rows: Select the dominant individuals by truncation selection with $\tau$ and
Sample the probabilistic model to generate the new dominant
Merge dominant individuals in the archive to form NEW_POP.

headers: $\tau, N P_{\max }, \max . n f e s, h, D, N P_{\min }$
rows: Select the $\tau N P$ individuals with small fitness values as the modeling population POP ${ }^{\text {mod }}$.
Establish the model according to Eqs. (4) and (5).
Sample and obtain $(1-\tau) N P$ observed individuals POP ${ }^{\text {obs }}$.
Merge POP ${ }^{\text {mod }}$ and POP ${ }^{\text {obs }}$ to form NEW_POP.
$P O P^{\text {obs }}$ is regarded as $P O P^{\text {rec }}$ at the first generation.
Perform Kalman filtering to obtain POP ${ }^{\text {rec }}$.
If the conditions for the first revision are satisfied do
Select $\tau+N P$ individuals of $P O P^{\text {rec }}$, and $P O P^{\text {rec }}(n f e s-1)$ in the archive $h$ as $P O P^{\text {mod }}$.
Establish the model according to Eqs. (12)-(13).
Calculate the population size of every generation according to Eq. (6).
Sample and obtain $(1-\tau) N P P O P^{\text {obs }}$.
